title: Financial Performance of Wynn Resorts Ltd

content.text: Wynn Resorts' revenue has shown volatility over the past few years. In 2018, the company reported a revenue of $6.72 billion, which experienced a decline of 3.7% compared to the previous year. However, in 2019, the company witnessed a growth in revenue to $6.61 billion, representing a decrease of 1.6% from the previous year.

Wynn Resorts' earnings have also displayed inconsistency. In 2018, the company recorded a net income of $572.4 million, reflecting a decline of 69% from the previous year. However, in 2019, there was a significant rebound with net income reaching $747.2 million, showcasing a growth of 30.5% compared to the previous year.

The cash flow situation of Wynn Resorts has been relatively stable over the examined time frame. In 2018, the company generated operating cash flow of $1.85 billion, representing a decline of 2.1% compared to the previous year. Similarly, in 2019, the company reported operating cash flow of $1.74 billion, exhibiting a decrease of 5.9% from the previous year.
